questions.question: What is multivariate analysis?
questions.explanation: Multivariate analysis involves the analysis of data that contains multiple variables, allowing for the understanding of complex relationships.

questions.question: What is the purpose of principal component analysis (PCA)?

options.A: To reduce the dimensionality of data.
options.B: To increase the dimensionality of data.

questions.explanation: Principal component analysis (PCA) is used to reduce the dimensionality of data, simplifying the data while retaining its essential characteristics.

questions.question: What is factor analysis?

options.A: A technique used to identify underlying factors that explain the pattern of correlations within a set of observed variables.
options.B: A technique used to destroy data.
options.C: A technique used to ignore data.
options.D: A technique used to collect data.

questions.explanation: Factor analysis is a technique used to identify underlying factors that explain the pattern of correlations within a set of observed variables, providing insights into the structure of the data.

questions.question: What is cluster analysis?

options.A: A technique used to group a set of objects in such a way that objects in the same group are more similar than those in other groups.
options.B: A technique used to destroy data.
options.C: A technique used to ignore data.
options.D: A technique used to collect data.

questions.explanation: Cluster analysis is a technique used to group a set of objects in such a way that objects in the same group are more similar than those in other groups, often used for pattern recognition.

questions.question: What is discriminant analysis?

options.A: A technique used to classify a set of observations into predefined classes.
options.B: A technique used to destroy data.
options.C: A technique used to ignore data.
options.D: A technique used to collect data.

questions.explanation: Discriminant analysis is a technique used to classify a set of observations into predefined classes, often used for classification and prediction.

questions.question: What is canonical correlation analysis?

options.A: A technique used to understand the relationships between two sets of variables.
options.B: A technique used to destroy data.
options.C: A technique used to ignore data.
options.D: A technique used to collect data.

questions.explanation: Canonical correlation analysis is a technique used to understand the relationships between two sets of variables, providing insights into their interdependencies.

questions.question: What is multidimensional scaling?

options.A: A technique used to visualize the level of similarity of individual cases of a dataset.
options.B: A technique used to destroy data.
options.C: A technique used to ignore data.
options.D: A technique used to collect data.

questions.explanation: Multidimensional scaling is a technique used to visualize the level of similarity of individual cases of a dataset, often used for data exploration.

questions.question: What is structural equation modeling (SEM)?

options.A: A technique used to analyze the structural relationships between measured variables and latent constructs.
options.B: A technique used to destroy data.
options.C: A technique used to ignore data.
options.D: A technique used to collect data.

questions.explanation: Structural equation modeling (SEM) is a technique used to analyze the structural relationships between measured variables and latent constructs, providing insights into complex relationships.

questions.question: What is path analysis?

options.A: A technique used to describe the directed dependencies among a set of variables.
options.B: A technique used to destroy data.
options.C: A technique used to ignore data.
options.D: A technique used to collect data.

questions.explanation: Path analysis is a technique used to describe the directed dependencies among a set of variables, often used for causal modeling.

questions.question: What is latent variable analysis?

options.A: A technique used to identify variables that are not directly observed but are inferred from other variables.
options.B: A technique used to destroy data.
options.C: A technique used to ignore data.
options.D: A technique used to collect data.

questions.explanation: Latent variable analysis is a technique used to identify variables that are not directly observed but are inferred from other variables, providing insights into hidden structures.

questions.question: What is hierarchical clustering?

options.A: A method of cluster analysis which seeks to build a hierarchy of clusters.

questions.explanation: Hierarchical clustering is a method of cluster analysis which seeks to build a hierarchy of clusters, often used for data exploration.

questions.question: What is k-means clustering?

options.A: A method of vector quantization, originally from signal processing, that is popular for cluster analysis in data mining.

questions.explanation: K-means clustering is a method of vector quantization, originally from signal processing, that is popular for cluster analysis in data mining, often used for pattern recognition.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a dendrogram?

options.A: To illustrate the arrangement of the clusters produced by hierarchical clustering.

questions.explanation: A dendrogram is used to illustrate the arrangement of the clusters produced by hierarchical clustering, providing a visual representation of the clustering process.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a heatmap?

options.A: To represent data values in a matrix form using color coding.

questions.explanation: A heatmap is used to represent data values in a matrix form using color coding, often used for data visualization.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a scree plot?

options.A: To show the proportion of variance explained by each principal component.

questions.explanation: A scree plot is used to show the proportion of variance explained by each principal component, often used in PCA to determine the number of components to retain.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a biplot?

options.A: To display the scores and loadings of a principal component analysis.

questions.explanation: A biplot is used to display the scores and loadings of a principal component analysis, providing insights into the relationships between variables and observations.
